intro: Impatiens irvingii, commonly known as the Irving's touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that come in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branching. Impatiens irvingii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
